CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper February 2, 1963, pg. 4, reads: "A 'First' - Sterling W. Perkins (fourth from left) of 7429 Susquehana St., recently became the first Negro tax assessor of Allegheny County. The swearing-in took place in the office of County Commissioner William D. McClelland. Shown above are (left to right) John L. Smith, chairman of the board of property assessment, appeals and review; County Commissioner John E. McGrady, co-sponsor of Perkins; Atty. Linn B. Washington, 13th Ward Democratic Chairman, who endorsed Perkins; Mr. Perkins; Frank Ventura, secretary and vice chairman of the board and Dr. McClelland, chairman of the County Commissioners and also co-sponsor. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: John L. Smith, John E. McGrady, Atty. Linn B. Washington, Sterling W. Perkins being sworn in as Allegheny County tax assessor, Frank Ventura, and County Commissioner William D. McClelland, in McClelland's office
